title: Danger Assessment Tool for Domestic Abuse
description: Predicts risk of death by intimate partner (IP) in violent intimate relationship. Validated lethality risk assessment instrument for intimate partner femicide developed by Dr. Jacquelyn Campbell at Johns Hopkins University.

parameters.name: physical_violence_increased
parameters.description: Has the physical violence increased in frequency or severity over the past year?

parameters.name: owns_gun
parameters.description: Does he own a gun?

parameters.name: threatened_weapon
parameters.description: Has he ever threatened or tried to kill you with a weapon?

parameters.name: threatened_kill_you
parameters.description: Has he threatened to kill you?

parameters.name: avoided_killing
parameters.description: Do you think he might try to kill you?

parameters.name: beaten_pregnant
parameters.description: Has he beaten you while you were pregnant?

parameters.name: jealous_controlling
parameters.description: Is he violently and constantly jealous of you?

parameters.name: controls_activities
parameters.description: Have you ever been beaten by him when he was drunk or high on drugs?

parameters.name: controls_daily_activities
parameters.description: Does he control most or all of your daily activities?

parameters.name: violent_others
parameters.description: Has he ever been violent toward your children?

parameters.name: violent_toward_others
parameters.description: Has he ever been violent toward other family members or friends?

parameters.name: threatened_suicide
parameters.description: Has he ever threatened or attempted suicide?

parameters.name: threatened_kill_children
parameters.description: Has he threatened to kill your children?

parameters.name: child_not_his
parameters.description: Do you have a child that is not his?

parameters.name: employment_problems
parameters.description: Has he lost his job in the past year?

parameters.name: follows_spies
parameters.description: Does he follow or spy on you, leave threatening notes, destroy your property, or call you when you don't want him to?

parameters.name: forced_sex
parameters.description: Has he forced you to have sex when you did not wish to do so?

parameters.name: tried_to_strangle
parameters.description: Has he ever tried to choke you?

parameters.name: drugs_alcohol_problems
parameters.description: Does he use illegal drugs?

parameters.name: stepchild_present
parameters.description: Is he an alcoholic or problem drinker?

result.name: danger_assessment
result.description: Danger assessment score with risk level and safety recommendations

ranges.interpretation: Danger is probably not extreme at this time, but safety planning is still important. Risk factors should be monitored and safety measures implemented. Consider periodic reassessment.

Risk of intimate partner homicide is elevated. Enhanced safety planning is essential. Consider coordinated community response and frequent reassessment. Professional intervention strongly recommended.

Risk of intimate partner homicide is severe and immediate. Emergency safety planning is critical. Law enforcement notification, shelter placement, and coordinated high-risk response may be necessary. Immediate professional intervention required.

clinical_applications: Healthcare provider screening in emergency departments

immediate_safety: Safe place identified to go in crisis
Safety plan for children if applicable
ongoing_safety: Regular safety plan review and updates

references: Campbell JC, Webster D, Koziol-McLain J, et al. Risk factors for femicide in abusive relationships: results from a multisite case control study. Am J Public Health. 2003;93(7):1089-1097. doi: 10.2105/ajph.93.7.1089.

Campbell JC, Webster DW, Glass N. The danger assessment: validation of a lethality risk assessment instrument for intimate partner femicide. J Interpers Violence. 2009;24(4):653-674. doi: 10.1177/0886260508317180.

Messing JT, Campbell J, Webster DW, et al. The Oklahoma Lethality Assessment Study: a quasi-experimental evaluation of the lethality assessment program. Soc Serv Rev. 2015;89(3):499-530. doi: 10.1086/682621.

Campbell JC, Alhusen JL, Draughon JE, Kub J, Walton-Moss B. Vulnerability and protective factors for intimate partner violence. In: Mitchell C, Anglin D, eds. Intimate Partner Violence: A Health-Based Perspective. Oxford University Press; 2009:143-162.
formula: Weighted scoring system based on validated risk factors with adjusted odds ratios from 11-city femicide study
notes: Developed and validated by Dr. Jacquelyn Campbell at Johns Hopkins University
Based on 11-city case-control study of intimate partner femicide
Requires specialized training for proper administration and interpretation
Should be used as part of comprehensive safety planning process
Risk assessment should be conducted in private, safe environment
Consider victim safety when documenting and storing assessment results
Tool is designed for use with women in heterosexual relationships
Regular reassessment recommended as risk factors can change over time
Professional consultation recommended for high-risk cases

validation.population: Women in abusive intimate partner relationships
validation.evidence_basis: Multi-site case-control study with 310 femicide cases and 324 controls
validation.clinical_utility: Validated lethality risk assessment with demonstrated predictive validity for intimate partner homicide
